results.title: The Lightship
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Skolimowski, Moritz Borman, Bill Beneson, Bill Benenson Productions and CBS Productions
results.brief_description: Based on an allegorical novella by Siegfried Lenz, this moody, carefully crafted suspense by Polish director Jerzy Skolimowski (Moonlighting, The Shout) is set in 1955 aboard an isolated U.S. Coast Guard lightship anchored in dangerous waters off the coast of Norfolk, Virginia. The pacifist captain (Klaus Maria Brandauer), is a German-American who is haunted by an event in his naval past when he was indirectly responsible for the deaths at sea of some sailors during WWII. When he rescues a drifting speedboat from an impending storm, he is confronted by a trio of modern day pirates led by the menacing, psychotic Caspary (played in a no-holds-barred performance by Robert Duvall), on their way to pick up illicit cargo. From the moment they board the lightship the thugs attempt to take control, resulting in a violent struggle between good and evil. With the atmosphere becoming increasingly tense and hostile, conflicts arise amongst the crew as their misguided attempts at heroism end tragically. Cast also includes Tom Bower, Robert Costanzo, and Michael Lyndon.

results.title: The Life of mammals: by David Attenborough. Ep.1-10
results.creator_credit: Mike Salisbury, BBC and Discovery Channel
results.brief_description: A comprehensive four disc set of the complete television series written and presented by Sir David Attenborough on the life of mammals. A moving orchestral score and majestic slow-motion wildlife cinematography is combined to great effect with the dulcet tones of Sir David making this another winning combination from the BBC/Discovery Channel co-production team. All ten episodes that make up the series run for approximately 50 minutes each. Music by Dan Jones and Ben Salisbury. Follow up website at www.bbc.co.uk/nature. Episode producers are: Mike Salisbury, Mark Lindfield, Vanessa Berlowitz, Neil Lucas and Huw Cordey. The episodes are: Ep.1 “A Winning design”. Evolutionary finesse has gone someway to making the mammal an effective survivor. Ep.2 “Insect hunters” looks at the way some animals need to consume insects. Ep.3 “Plant predators” shows the call for for some mammals to vigorously consume plants. Ep. 4 “Chisellers” looks at mammals with sharp front teeth - rodents from around the world. Ep. 5 “Meat eaters” shows the carnivorous nature of some mammals - not as a choice but a case of survival. Ep. 6 “Opportunists” is about the adaptable omnivore’s successful food choices. Ep. 7 “Return to water” shows the small number of mammals that through evolutionary necessity have returned to the water. Ep. 8 “Life in the trees” looks at tree dwelling mammals and their adaptation to that particular environment. Ep. 9 “Social climbers” looks at the community and group nature of some types of mammals. Ep. 10 “Food for thought” is a contemplation on the human as the most successful mammal of them all.

results.title: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger, Rank Film Productions and The Archers
results.brief_description: The producing and directing team of Powell and Pressburger resulted in some of British cinema’s finest films. “Colonel Blimp” is a deeply romantic film, but its emotionalism is kept in check by the cast’s English reserve. During the Boer War a young English soldier meets a German soldier and they are to continue a friendship that will take them through three wars on opposite sides of battle. Deborah Kerr features as the woman they both love. Also stars Roger Livesey and Roland Culver.
results.title_for_label: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp

results.title: The Last Emperor
results.creator_credit: Bernardo Bertolucci, Jeremy Thomas and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1908 three year old Pu Yi becomes Emperor of Imperial China. In the course of his life-time he will be treated as a God, become a playboy and traitor, and finally end up jailed by the communists. The end of his life is spent happily as a humble gardener. Bertolucci’s film is an astonishing visual treat, encompassing both the history of China in the twentieth century, and elegantly detailing the story of the country’s last imperial ruler. Stars John Lone, Peter O’Toole and Joan Chen. Winner of nine Academy Awards (including Best Picture). The music is by David Byrne and Ryuichi Sakamoto.

results.title: The Last Bolshevik
results.creator_credit: Chris Marker, Michael Kustow and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Chris Marker, the acclaimed director of “Sunless” is one of the cinema’s most compelling documentary film-makers. This engrossing film is firstly a tribute to Alexander Medvedkin, a Soviet film-maker and revolutionary, who eventually to fell victim to Stalin’s infamous purges. “The Last Bolshevik”, framed around six imaginary letters to Medvedkin by Marker, is also a mediation on the history of Soviet communism and a critical examination of revolutionary aesthetics. Marker was a central figure in the French New Wave and was involved in rehabilitating Medvedkin’s career in the late-1960s. It is then also a personal self-appraisal of the artist’s own politics and aesthetics, an appraisal which aims to investigate what drew artists to the radicalism of Soviet Bolshevism and the consequences for “radical art” now that Communism has been discredited. The film not only explores Medvedkin’s work but also the cinema of Eisenstein and Dziga-Vertov. A documentary that assumes intelligence and philosophical eruditness from its audience is rare indeed. This melancholy farewell to the dream of “creating utopia” is a wonderful film.

results.title: The King of Marvin Gardens
results.brief_description: Radio personality David Staebler (Jack Nicholson), uses his brother’s life story as fodder for his radio ramblings, thus anticipating the “talk jocks” of the 1980’s and 90’s. David’s brother Jason (Bruce Dern), is full of lofty ambitions but lacks the wherewithal to accomplish them. He has managed to survive for so long thanks to the help of his older brother. His latest vision for success involves building a resort on a small Hawaiian island and he intends to raise the capital by holding a beauty contest and wining and dining rich Japanese businessmen. Along with Jason’s long suffering wife (Ellen Burstyn), David reluctantly agrees to support his brother one more time.

results.title: The Graduate (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Turman, Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), Lawrence Turman Inc and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: Mentally adrift after graduating from college, Benjamin Braddock is pressured by both family and friends to take on the responsibilities of adulthood, namely to marry and find a job. But the exhortation of family friend, Mr. Robinson, to seize every possible opportunity inspires Ben to accept Mrs. Robinson’s offers of sex. Shortly after, Ben is pushed into dating the Robinsons’ daughter, Elaine, and after falling in love with her he finds himself in the compromising position of maintaining a relationship with both women. Also includes a 45 min. documentary on the making of the film. Cast includes: Dustin Hoffman, Anne Bancroft, Katherine Ross, William Daniels, Elizabeth Wilson and Murray Hamilton.

results.title: The Graduate
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Lawrence Turman, Lawrence Turman Inc and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Dustin Hoffman stars as college graduate Benjamin Braddock, who spends his first summer out of school being seduced by the wife of his father’s best friend. He also falls in love with the woman’s daughter to further complicate his life. Nominated for 7 Academy Awards, The Graduate won the Oscar for Best Direction, (Mike Nichols), and its brilliant score by Simon and Garfunkle won 3 Grammies. Ann Bancroft is the memorable Mrs. Robinson, with Katherine Ross as her daughter and rival for Benjamin’s affection. “The Graduate” is a modern comedy classic to be enjoyed again and again.

results.title: The Golden Louis
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: A tale of choice between a gambler’s need and his pity for a young homeless girl. Cast includes Anita Hendrie, Adele DeGarde, Owen Moore, Charles Inslee, Mack Sennett. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Flight of the Gossamer Condor
results.creator_credit: Jacqueline Shedd, Shedd Productions and Ben Shedd
results.brief_description: The story of how Dr. Paul MacCready won the Kemer Prize for the first man-powered aircraft that could fly a mile long figure of eight course. Follows the inventor through twelve months of planning and disappointments as he develops his idea from the first crude wing into a sophisticated craft that flies the course.
